dialogues.text: Let's leave the man in peace so he can get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both lied to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't lie to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEYCUTT, a rotund, elder black man who is one of cast members, is warming the audience up.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: It's very young and diverse.  They are laughing at the co stylings of Honeycutt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Sloan take their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, Jukka.  Do a good show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.  I always try my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is slowly getting dressed.  He puts on an old, tattered tails (tuxedo).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat is also getting dressed.  He wears a worn Pullman Porter uniform with red hat to match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty with his black wife in hand, VERNA moves toward Delacroix and Sloan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet my lovely wife Verna.  Honey, this is Pierre Delacroix and Sloan Hopkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleasure is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband has been raving about the awesome work you've done.  How did you ever think of something like this?  It's absolutely brilliant.  Pure genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it was divine inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope to see you both after the taping.  Congrats in advance.

dialogues.speaker: ON CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Verna and Dunwitty go to the front of the control booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Sloan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divine inspiration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to apologize about my brother and the Mau-Mau's.  I should not have imposed them on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  You were only doing what family is supposed to be doing for family.  You gave your brother a shot.  That's all anybody can ask for, an opportunity, a chance, a shot.  He got his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is in front of his dressing room mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: Mantan looks, stares at his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat is staring at himself also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should blacken up like they did it back in the day.  Keep the ritual the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan puts some corks in a dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour some alcohol on the corks, then light it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat strikes a match to his corks in a dish.

dialogues.speaker: SLEEP 'N EAT
dialogues.text: He watches the cork burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them burnt to a crisp, and when burnt out, mash them to a powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is mashing the corks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Add water, mix to a thick paste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat is mixing it all together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And voila!  You have your blackface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience, which has become restless, starts a rhythmi clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please put cocoa butter on your face and hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To protect your skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He applies cocoa butter to his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ON SLEEP 'N EAT'S FACE
dialogues.text: He rubs cocoa butter all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: HANDS
dialogues.text: Audience hands are clapping faster.

dialogues.speaker: ON FEET
dialogues.text: They're stomping.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: Mantan blacks up his face.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat blacks up also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final detail...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...are the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is applying lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: ON LIPS
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat is puckering his lips as he too puts on the lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The redder the lipstick the better. I suggest firetruck red.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: For the first time WE SEE SLEEP 'N EAT in FULL BLACK FACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show...

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: Mantan in FULL BLACK FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...TIME!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is in an uproar when the lights go down.  Th applaud and they quiet as the CURTAIN GOES UP on a bucoli setting.  It is a combination of WATERMELON PATCH and COT FIELD.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: First Sleep 'N Eat then Mantan shuffles onto the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my best friend Sleep 'N Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is my very best friend Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're two real COONS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience lets out nervous laughter.  They don't know what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both left the hustle and bustle of Uptown, Harlem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the big apple, New York, New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To come back to our roots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Alabamy Home.  Now we're getting countrified.  We is Bama's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mo' "city slickers."  Ahh, can't you smell the sweet aroma of the ripe watermelons and high cotton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell 'em what you mean Mistuh Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you Mistuh Sleep 'N Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give or cousins some of dem educated feets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan begins to do a slow, steady step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousins, first, second, third and distant, let's have Mantan take us all the way back to a much more simpler time.  A time wen men were men, women were women, and Neggras knew their place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE is aghast.  Mantan has picked up the pace. He's tapping fast and furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousins, I want all of you to go to your windows.  Go to your windows and yell.  Yell, I'm tired of the drugs, the crack babies born out of wedlock to crackhead aids infested parents.  I'm tired of the inflated welfare rolls while good wholesome Americans bring less and less of their paycheck home every two weeks. I'm tired, you're tired, we're all tired of these so-called bible- thumping God fearing, whore mongling Professional athletes.  Aren't you tired of these basketball-dunking, football-running, hop-hip rapping ebonic-speaking sex offenders who got ten kids from ten different Ho's?  I know I am and so is Sleep 'N Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tellin' the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your windows and yell out, scream with all the life you can muster up inside your assaulted, bruised and battered bodies.  I'M SICK AND TIRED OF NIGGERS AND I'M NOT GONNA TAKE IT ANYMORE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan stops dancing and collapses.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: They're stunned.  They can't believe what they've heard, what they've seen.  What they've been witness to.

dialogues.speaker: ON YOUNG WHITE COUPLE
dialogues.text: They look at the black people in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: ON YOUNG HIP-HOP BLACK MALE
dialogues.text: He starts to clap slowly.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Slowly more black people begin to applaud.  Slowly it swe up into the black people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHITE AUDIENCE, of course, has been waiting to see ho their black brothers and sisters would react.  Now feelin comfortable and safe, they too being to join the applause

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The applause changes into laughter.  It is not nervous laughter we hear, but straight out RIOTOUS LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: ON BLACK AND WHITE FACES
dialogues.text: The laughter is contagious.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Mantan starts to move, he's coming back from the dead.  H slowly gets up from his prostate position as he HEARS: A WAYBACK ALABAMA JIG played by the house band, THE PORCH MONKEYS, led by musical director Levi.  Mantan is joined stage by the other hoofers in the show: JUNGLE BUNNY, SNOWFLAKE, SAMBO, AUNT JEMIMA, RASTUS, NIGGER JIM, plus SLEEP 'N EAT.  Each take turn as it evolves into an elabo DANCE NUMBER.  The hoofers and the band are also in black face.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: They are rolling down the aisles.

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: Delacroix looks like he has seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He buries his face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is in the same position as the scene before.  F buried in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ON PHONE
dialogues.text: It rings and he picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty drives his Mercedes Benz CL 600 Coupe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, DeLa, I just got the news from the CNS brass.  They saw some clips from the pilot and they're rushing it onto the air.  Yo, we're a midseason replacement, ordered 12 shows.  We're on in 3 weeks.  Didya hear what I just said, Yo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't even view a rough cut, just some scenes we quickly cut together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has to be a big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big mistake was my not believing in your genius earlier.  From the gitgo, from jump street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a sec, I got a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mommy, let me get rid of this other call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gots to go, it's my Moms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to meet her one day, please tell her the great news.  I'm OUT like Vanilla Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is on the phone with her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peerless, your father called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a warm summer night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's up with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an asthmatic.  Been one all my life.  Can't go anywhere without an inhaler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to rap to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix sits at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants you to come and see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's performing at some place outside of Richmond, Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go all the way down south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richmond is not all the way down south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know why you're still concerned over him.  Daddy's not with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regardless, he still is your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be hard for me to get away with the show taking off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more reason to see him.  He'll be overjoyed with your success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mommy.  Daddy hasn't been impressed with anything I've ever done.  From winning my fifth grade Spelling Bee to the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peerless, last time, go see your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan and Sloan are sitting on a park bench, nothing is being said.  He sits up and starts to do a dance for her. To her.

dialogues.speaker: ON BENCH
dialogues.text: Mantan is doing that "Mating" tap dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to seduce me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his index finger over his mouth - "Quiet."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's gonna work, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly jumps up on the bench, does some intricate ste then pulls Sloan up from her sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: ON MANTAN AND SLOAN
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is driving "down south."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix adjusts the mirror so he can see himself.  HE SPEAKS TO US through the MIRROR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured this was a good time to get away.  Just jump in my ride and go.  I always did my best thinking when I was driving alone.  I needed to think out clearly what I was going to do with this MANTAN - THE NEW MILLENNIUM MINSTREL SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is driving on his way to "Ole Virginny."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix pulls up in the parking lot of a rinky-kink, funky, greasy BAR/CLUB/BAR-B-Q joint.

dialogues.speaker: NEON SIGN
dialogues.text: "MAMA'S SUGAR SHAK" - most the letters do not light up, underneath it, "2-NITE - JUNEBUG."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's loud as hell as Delacroix enters this smoky, dark establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be a big night in here because the PATRONS are dressed to the nines.  What's in style down here is a lot different from what's happening en Nueva York.  Many of t men are dressed like PIMPS from 70's BLAXPLOITATION FILM, the ladies like HOOTCHIE MAMAS from "Luke" video.

dialogues.speaker: ON SUGAR SHAK
dialogues.text: Delacroix works himself through the crowded BAR/DISCO int another small room.

dialogues.speaker: ON COMEDY ROOM
dialogues.text: He walks into a small space where his father JUNEBUG is o the stage.

dialogues.speaker: ON JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: He is a good-looking man, the only speckle of gray in his hair betrays his age.  As he walks around the small stage doing his comedy stylings, he keeps a drink in one hand a sips it often.

dialogues.speaker: ON COMEDY ROOM
dialogues.text: Delacroix sits in the back so his father can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead in here.  The room is nearly empty.

dialogues.speaker: ON TABLE
dialogues.text: A couple gets loud, arguing over something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cuse me.  Please.  Can you please show me some respect.  I'm up here trying to make a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind yo' business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me have to come over there and whoop you upside ya head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sparse AUDIENCE laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just messin' with ya.  But please if you and your lady need to discuss something, take it outside. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues on with his show.

dialogues.speaker: ON TABLE
dialogues.text: Delacroix walks over to the fighting couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother man, that's my father up there and I drove a long way to see him perform.  Please take this fifty, go buy you and the young lady some drinks in the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy looks him up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's yo' Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need yo money for drinks. Besides, she's drunk already. C'mon, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy grabs his friend by the wrist and drags her kicki and screaming out the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bring your woman out if you can't keep her in deep check.  If my woman ever did something crazy like that I'd put my size 12 dead up in her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets the biggest laugh of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away, unless you got my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Peerless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters into a closet, it's a makeshift dressing room. younger lady, much younger than Junebug - DOT - stands behind him as she massages his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junebug gets up from his chair, rushes to his son and the embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son.  Good to seeya.  Good to seeya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up a chair.  Oh, excuse me, this is my lady DOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to meet you, too.  You are all your father talks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, pour me and my son a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both sit down as drinks are poured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave you two alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses Junebug on the forehead before leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good woman.  I trained her right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, she's younger than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My game is still strong.  No Viagra for me, don't need no chemicals. Just my tonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up his drink and kills it in one gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purely for medicinal purposes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had promised Mommy you stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.  I'm not an alcoholic.  I just like to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you end up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did I end up at the third rate chittlin' circuit greasy hole in the wall in West Hell, Virginny? Is that what you're asking ya Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix takes a sip of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm askin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I had too much pride.  Too much integrity.  I wouldn't lick nobody's butt.  Some material I refused to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, it can't be just because of that.  There had to be other factors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junebug pours himself another stiff one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only reason, period. They only want one certain kind of black comic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one of your conspiracies to hold ya career back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is what happened to me. All that other mess I just file into the "life's too short" category.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs another one.  Junebug drinks like a fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough about me, what's happening with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same old, same old.  Trying to get my stuff through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dem white boys giving you a hard time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuthin' I can't handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is never let them seeya sweat.  You do that, that's half the battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you go from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three nights Charleston, South Carolina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean that, in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In life?  I'ma keep on living, having a good drink, got me a good young woman, make a couple of dollars and make people laugh. Haven't I always tol' you all nigga's are entertainers?  The question is what are you gonna do, Peerless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Dot are on either side of Junebug as they h him up.

dialogues.speaker: ON DOOR
dialogues.text: Delacroix struggles to put the key in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked open as the trio comes in.  Junebug is drunk as a skunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an alcoholic.  I just like to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know that baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him over to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, you treat me so good. Peerless, you're a good son, I love you.  You never gave me no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lay him down on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always keep 'em laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dot takes off his shoes.  He's out like a light.  Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has my father been like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that often.  He was excited to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he drank himself into a stuper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drinking is for the pain.  It doesn't kill it, just dulls it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's up with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a hostess at this club, your Daddy was performing and I had never laughed so hard in my life. He asked me to come with him.  I quit my job and we've been together ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix pulls out his billfold and gives Dot five crisp new model hundred dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him it's from me or he won't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father is proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never showed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did the best way he knew how, Junebug is stubborn just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix kisses his sleeping father of the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is driving back home - up North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Daddy.  I'm not mad at him.  Not at all.  Junebug was the reason I got into this business in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thank him for that.  However, it did me no good seeing him in that state.  Daddy was a broken man. He had been a strong man, with conviction, integrity, principles and look where it had gotten him. I had to ask myself did I want to end up where he was?

dialogues.speaker: OVERHEAD REAR VIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: Delacroix adjusts the mirror so he can see himself, and SPEAK TO US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the last time I ever saw my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix's car flies past us.

dialogues.speaker: ON MIRROR
dialogues.text: Mantan starts to black up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat also begins to black up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt stands in front of the festive young, mixed audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody say Ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'swhatI'mtalkin'bout! That'swhatI'mtalkin'bout!  I want to be the first to welcome you to the second taping of Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Honeycutt and I want to try something different.  Can you do this for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna start a chant and I want y'all to follow me.  Let's make our own 2 real coons know you're ready to start the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go Niggers.  Then clap five times like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt claps the cadence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound so good to me.  Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, without further adieu, let's welcome youknowwhoI'mtalkin'about, your two favorite coons, Da Dusky Duo, our stars Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat.

dialogues.text: Oh her.

dialogues.text: Tomorrow is her birthday and I want to get her something really nice, like a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad.  How 'bout a dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat, one of dem slinky, sexy, little foxy...

dialogues.text: Mantan cocks his limp wrist.  The audience ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I thought you got rid of...

dialogues.text: I'll buy her a less expensive dress, so I can have some money left over to take her out to dinner.

dialogues.text: We should go out on a double date.

dialogues.text: I heard ya lady is wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  That's her second cousin. Who's married to Li'l Bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, because on our first date, she let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, she didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I heard different, thought that was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: So when are you comin' to pick us up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around...

dialogues.text: ...too late, maybe around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say who goes in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody in here 'cept us chickens.

dialogues.text: Massa Charlie enters the chicken coops with a SHOTGUN blazing.  Sleep 'N Eat and Mantan do a jig as they try to escape the buckshot.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: They're rolling down the aisles in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the booth is laughing uncontrollably.  Except Delacroix.  Even Sloan is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's side are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't help it.  It's too funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix starts to crack a smile.  He is definitely tryi to hold it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in front of the television, which is off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the Day of Reckoning.  After a massive advertising and publicity campaign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix stares at the blank screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the public would finally get a chance to view Mantan.  I was feelin' a little bit like Dr. Frankenstein.

dialogues.text: Sloan, Jessica, Mantan and Cheeba are gathered around the television in the small studio apartment, jabbering away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would their reaction be?  I hadn't the foggiest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see the OPENING of MANTAN - THE NEW MILLENNIUM MINSTRE SHOW.  It is in CLAYMATION.  Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat are doing a "jig."  Their noses and lips are done in a grotes characterization, BIG WIDE BEGROIDAL NOSES and JUICY RED SAUCER SOUP COOLING LIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling all my cousins, you're about to take a trip down to Hang 'Em High Plantation, home of your two favorite coons, Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why they gotta make my nose so big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it looks cute.

dialogues.speaker: ON SLOAN
dialogues.text: She can't believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show is proudly sponsored by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Da Bomb.  We'll take you there. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Timmi Hillnigger.  Keep it really real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will be right back with the start of our show, but first, a word from our proud sponsors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRACK is BOOMING.  The fire hydrant is open on this sizzling day and practically butt naked "Playaz" and "Hoe dance in the water.  Each one is guzzling from 64 ounce JUGULARS of DA BOMB which are in the shape of a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: ON HONEYCUTT AND CROWD
dialogues.text: He's in the spot, he's the spokesperson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA BOMB.  Yo.  It's 125% pure pleasure MALT LIQUOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Da Bomb, Baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Da Bomb, Baby.

dialogues.speaker: ON CROWD
dialogues.text: Nothing but butts and breasts gyrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clinical testing has found that Viagra doesn't work on black "johnson's."  That's why our scientists developed Da Bomb for you.  It makes you feel like a MAN and it makes dem bitches feel like Natural Women - I mean Ho's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes my nature rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get funked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DA BOMB - 125% pure pleasure malt liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt takes a big swallow from his 64 oz. Jugular.  T statuesque ladies sandwich him, grinding up on Honeycutt. He takes the jugular from his lips.  As he speaks, flames come out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooo-weeee!!  Da Bomb makes me wanna get my freak on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt, let's get our swerve on@

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A middled-aged Caucasian male, TIMMI HILLNIGGER, is surrounded by a mob deep of hard-looking PLAYAZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, my name be Timmi Hillnigger.  I was born and raised up in Strong Island so you know I know about my peeps, my niggaz in the git-toe.  I design and own TIMMI HILLNIGGER 125% Authentic Git-Toe active wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWG #1 steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hillnigger keeps it real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWG #2 steps forward also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timmi's gots all da latest gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to keep it really real, never get out of the git-toe, stay broke and continue to add to my multibillion dollar corporation, keep buyin' all my gear.  The Timmi Hillnigger collection.  We keep it so real we give you the bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoe #1 laying in a white thong on top of a white Rolls-Ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my niggaz wear Hillnigger or they don't wear a damn thing at all. It's Git-toe Fabulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are on in the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sunk, dead.  My goose was cooked.  The cat was in the bag and the bag was in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Clinton is seen behind a TV set laughing his he off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President of the U.S. stands behind a podium and take questions from the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you watch MANTAN - THE NEW MILLENNIUM MINSTREL SHOW last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did and I can honestly say I feel it promotes racial healing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty, Delacroix and Sloan are joined by a young Cauca woman, MYRNA GOLDFARB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all of you have seen the overnight ratings.  Through the roof.  But in this game you gotta be one, two, three steps ahead.  I introduce you to Myrna Goldfarb. She's the best media consultant in the biz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, I would like to say I love the show.  It's very courageous. My parents marched in Selma, Alabama with Dr. King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question, straight to the point.  I like your style.  Because of the content of the show we can expect some spirited reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myrna is here to help us plan our strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best defense is offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get my point.  I've mapped out some strategies to help bolster our position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That this is fun.  Nice wholesome fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfarb, run it down for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mantan Manifesto.  Catchy ain't it?  Number One.  We gainfully employ African Americans, in front of and behind the cameras.  Two. Let the audience decide.  Three. Who put these critics in charge? These so-called cultural police? Four.  Who determines what is black? Five.  Mantan is a satire.  Six. If they can't take a joke, "F" 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all stick to this, it's smooth sailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds kinda simplistic to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done my research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are black folks we're talkin' about, not some lab mice in a cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur Delacroix, I got my PhD in African-American studies from Yale, so I do feel I'm qualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let Myrna finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  And always smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, show dem pearly whites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wear Kente cloth, invoke the name of Dr. Martin Luther King, use the word "community" often when talking about Mantan.  And finally our biggest plus is you, Pierre Delacroix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This show was created, conceived by you, a non-threatening African- American male.  Voila.  End of argument.  It can't be racist because you're black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not black.  I'm a NEGRO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan and Delacroix are walking in the hallway.  They kee getting interrupted by people who congratulate Delacroix the success of the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have your small victory, now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small victory isn't that small when you've been use to losing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan hands Delacroix a wrapped gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what you think, you did come up with something unique. Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix opens his gift.  It is one of those old cast ir Black Collectibles.  This one is called "THE JOLLY NIGGER BANK," a head of a Negro, big lips, big nose, wide eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a coin in the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a quarter in the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the lever and the mouth opens, the quarter fli in and his eyes go to the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jolly Nigger Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is authentic, not a repro, circa turn of the century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was appropiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all good.  You got a hit show, you're gonna need a bank.  Plus, I love these old black collectibles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To me, it shows part of our history in this country, a time when we were considered inferior, sub-human.

dialogues.speaker: JOLLY NIGGER BANK
dialogues.text: Delacroix puts another quarter in the hand and flips the lever.  The quarter flies into his mouth as his eyes roll the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is a guest on the GARY BYRD show.  WLIB is the number one black talk radio station in the nation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guest today is Pierre Delacroix. He is the creator of the highly controversial TV show MANTAN. Let's get right into it.  You have been called by some in the community a traitor, a sellout, an Uncle Tom. Why does your show generate such feelings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because race has always been a sensitive issue in this country. Gary, I have no problem with people disagreeing with the show, it's when folks start trying to mess with my inherent right as an artist, that's when I get mad.  No one, in any way, shape or form should be censored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how sexist or racist the material may be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  And I say yes because who is to judge?  Who is to stand before us and say this is righteous and this is not?  Who?  Who can play God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the line has to be drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you people get it?  We're in the 21st Century.  Slavery was over four hundred years ago.  All that stuff people talked in the old days, it's over.  Folks always crying, white man this, white man that.  Let's all grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to excuse our Holocaust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I finish?  Thank you.  I had a great Aunt, we called her Sister. She went to her grave not believing man had walked on the Moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a little kid, I would argue with her, "it's on TV."  She would answer "I don't care what's on that idiot box.  No MAN is on the MOON."  Well, there are a lot of your Negroes just like my Aunt Sister.  Face up to it.  The world has changed and if you don't adapt, change with it, you will be left behind.  This show is a parody. Are you telling me that nobody can use some humor, have some laughs in their lives?  Is that what you're telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan and Cheeba gaze skyward at a behemoth billboard fo their show.  Some people recognize them and start asking autographs and a crowd forms.

dialogues.speaker: ON MANTAN AND CHEEBA
dialogues.text: They're enjoying the adulation.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORNER
dialogues.text: Big Black and the Mau-Mau's also look up at the 2 REAL CO billboard.  Their faces say they are not happy.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN FLAG
dialogues.text: It blows majestically in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When American people want something, they want it now, they want it big.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREEL FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Kids swinging in their hula hoops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted the hula hoop...

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREEL FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Kids playing with their yo-yo's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted their yo-yo's.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSREEL FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: A young girl petting her Pet Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could ever forget those lovable pet rocks.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TOYS "R" US
dialogues.text: Parents are fighting over Beanie Babies.  It's a RUCKUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beanie Babies...
