dialogues.text: Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat are doing a tap dance on the GIAN DIAMONDVISION SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the latest, hottest, newest sensation across the nation was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACKFACE!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE AMERICANS - young, old, black and white in BLACKFA MANTAN and SLEEP 'N EAT are #1 and #2 in the best-selling Halloween masks.  They fly out of the stores.  We SEE Man and Sleep 'N Eat THE DUSKY DUO Action Dolls, backpacks, lunch boxes, T-shirts, jackets, board games, watches, and CD-Rom video games.  Football players, wrestlers in black face also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Black stands behind 1/16th Black who sits in front of laptop computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Black, I can't log on the Mantan Website now, it's overloaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show at www.nigger.com was getting 500,000 hits a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mercedes-Benz salesman is showing Mantan all the newest latest models.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan and Cheeba sit at a big table with Puff Daddy, And Harrell, Russell Simmons and other assorted RAPPERS. Everyone is drinking that DOM P.  Buxom Hotties sit in between the BIG WILLIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of protesters led by the REVEREND JESSE JACKSON a AL SHARPTON carry signs and banners objecting to Mantan. They're calling upon the FCC to pull the show off the air and for the boycotting of the show's two sponsors: TIMMI HILLNIGGER and DA BOMB MALT LIQUOR.

dialogues.speaker: ON PROTESTERS
dialogues.text: The press is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix has now decorated his entire office with Black Collectibles Art.  WE SEE black jockey lawn pieces, banks mammies, signs for products, etc.

dialogues.speaker: ON WINDOW
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Mantan are looking out the office window do on the protesters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is Jess and Reverend Al down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they can be on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like the media.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nothing.  It will blow over by tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing Giuliani said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow it will be all about cruelty to animals or some sex scandal.  Besides, there is no such thing as bad publicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Mantan a wrapped gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest your mind.  It's a little somethin' something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan opens it.  He pulls out an old pair of tap shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those were the last pair of tap shoes worn by Bill "Bojangles" Robinson.  In fact, he died with them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No joke.  Serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope the same thing doesn't happen to me.  That's some big shoes to fill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's are in meeting.  They all drink 64 ounce jugulars of Da Bomb, are all attired from head to toe in TIMMI HILLNIGGER Active Ghetto Wear and brandish their 9'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Tom, That Negro...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that handkerchief head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dancing monkey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Benedict Arnold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that simpleton is holding back the race.  They got rid of us and keep those two buffoons, Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat, y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Big Black, Sleep 'N Eat ain't even a nigger, y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Mexican, y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Dominican, y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Peter Rican, y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing, y'knowwhatI'msayin', y'knowwhatI'msayin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know.  We know.  Yo, check it, my black brothers, we can't let this slide.  Not this injustice. Nah, no way.  Dem' two real coons iz ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1/16, tru' 'dat.  True 'dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me gat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, too easy, this has to be symbolic, has to be on the world stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is showing Sloan his new residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a nice place.  It must have cost a pretty penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan, I got it like 'dat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you do, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little something' somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you save a little somethin' somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gots no intention of ending up broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, at the beginnin' of the century, African-American had to perform in blackface.  You ever heard of Bert Williams?  He was a great artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, before my time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't read, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never read a book in my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you need to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I need to do a lot of things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bert Williams and the rest, they had to black up.  They had no choice.  They were considered 3/5ths of a human being.  Did you know that's written in the Constitution of the United States?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why all of a sudden are you flippin' on me?  This blackface thing was part of the deal from the git-go. Don't even try to play it like you ain't a part of all this.  You down with Delacroix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want you and Cheeba to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can look out for ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat is applying his black face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan also puts on his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a warm nigger applause for our two favorite coons, Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat.  TWO REAL COONS!

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The entire audience is in BLACK FACE.  They applaud, yell cheer wildly.  This is becoming a religious cult.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: The curtain rises on Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat.  They are i cotton field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell out of my bed last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept too near where you got in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slept too near where I fell out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect the unexpected in circumstances of that peculiarity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat, what's the matter with you?  Using all dose ten dollar words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan, it is possible that my hyphenated sentences are entirely too complex for all the intellect contained in that diminutive coconut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, you allegorical hypothesis. Don't cross words with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't Jemima on the pancake box?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dat's yo Uncle Ben.  That reminds me, I've seen a lot of troubles lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How be dat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be an Alabama porch monkey's uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago I married a widow who had a grown-up daughter.  My daddy visited us often, fell in love with my stepdaughter and married her. Thusly he became my son-in-law and my stepdaughter became my mother because she was my father's wife. Soon after dis my wife gave birth to a son, which of course was my father's brother in-law and my uncle, for he was the brother of my step-mother.  My father's wife also became the mother of a son.  He was of course my brother and also my grandchild for he was the son of my daughter.  Accordingly, my wife was my grandmother because she was my mother's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat, I was my wife's husband and grandchild at one and the same time.  And lo' and behold, as the husband of a person's grandmother is his grandfather, I Mantan, became my own grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan, dat sho' is a whopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both start to do the jig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is dying laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't hold out any longer, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ON SLOAN
dialogues.text: She looks at Delacroix, her face tells us she's not amuse at all.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: The Dusky Duo is joined on the cotton patch by Snowflake, Rastus, Sambo, Nigga Jim, Jungle Bunny, Aunt Jemima, And Porch Monkeys Band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel a song a comin' on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A song a comin' I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porch Monkeys kick in and Mantan sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell right dead in love/wid da sweetest little dove/little LuLu Snow from Tennessee/she made a slave of me/an' from her I'se never free/I'd do anything she'd ask me to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep 'N Eat takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De money I did save/to dat yeller gal I gave/for to keep till we was wed/she told me dat nobody'd get away dat cash/I'll take good care of date, she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody joins in for the chorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's de cutest gal in all dis world I know/If you met her you would say it so/Oh, Lulu, Lulu, ev'ry day I pines for you/no other gal will do/All I've got is yours for life, my little, my little yaller Lou/A week ago dat Lou wid anudder nigger flew/took ma money too, all I had/She broke ma heart in two/when I heard dat she had flew/Do you wonder dat I feel so bad?/She told me not to cry 'case she didn't say good bye/but she'd take care of dat red/and nobody would get de cash away from her/She'd keep her word to me she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau clan surrounds the television monitor, howlin in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gots to be did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he gots to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is leading the meeting of the staff writers on Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my astonishment, not only did the people in TV land love us, but also the critics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan was being hailed as groundbreaking, barrier breaking, also earth shaking.  I looked forward to my awards.  Just vindication for all my hard work, all my talent that had been previously overlooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix sits in tux amongst many stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winner for Best New Sitcom is... The envelope please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A starlet hands him the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winner is... Pierre Delacroix for Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix jumps out og his chair and starts sobbing.  Two ushers have to help him to the stage.  He is overcome wit emotion.  The audience is on their feet with a standing ovation.  He hugs Alec Baldwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec Baldwin, this is the very first time we've ever met, you don't know this, I'm your biggest fan and I want you to have my Emmy. It's for you, out of the deep bowels of my heart - I don't deserve this.  You take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alec Baldwin is shocked.  He grabs Delacroix in a bear hu and they both cry like babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I did that I'd be assured to work forever.  Delacroix the grateful Negro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix sits at a table in his lucky tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winner for Best Sit-Com is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woody opens the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Pierre Delacroix for Mantan. Come on up and get your Golden Globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix jumps out of his seat and sprints.  He gets dow on the stage and starts to breakdance, even spinning on h head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That routine would go over like gangbusters.  I would be a dancing fool, Hollywood's new favorite Negro, move over Danny, Morgan, Samuel L., move over Whoopi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is finishing up the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it all planned.  To the T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is running rigorous rehearsal of The Pikaninnies. Over and over, repetition after repetition, Snowflake, Rastus, Sambo, Nigger Jim, Jungle Bunny and Aunt Jemima t to do an intricate dance step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of you pickaninnies messing up my choreography.  It goes like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan does the step with ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dancers do it once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeba walks in.  Mantan checks him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a ten minute break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quickly file past Cheeba without saying a word.  The rehearsal space is just the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not drinking the Kool-Aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Jones, y'know.  I'm not drinking the Kool-Aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I've got a broken back from carrying you all these years anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what you been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn skippy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in this up till ya neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot me, I'm just the piano players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can walk away.  We both can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's easy for you to do. You never had any talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so tired of you running that. I always worked hard for you.  You think I'm a leech, a kling-on, I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheeba walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the star of Mantan, so you do that.  Quit, walk away.  And don't come crawling back, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan and Sloan ride in back.  He's still thinking about Cheeba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  He left.  Not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo drives past the World Famous Apollo Theatre in Harlem, a big crowd is in front.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON THEATRE
dialogues.text: It READS: MANTAN THE MARVELOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an unruly, fired up crowd that can be heard all the back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure this is a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, she doesn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long, deep kiss she gently pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be down front.  You better start putting your face on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look beautiful like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan takes a seat down front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan, face already done, puts on the firetruck red lips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan is looking around this boisterous crowd when she se

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MAU-MAU'S
dialogues.text: In one of the side boxes.

dialogues.speaker: ON BIG BLACK
dialogues.text: He waves to his sister.

dialogues.speaker: ON SLOAN
dialogues.text: She knows her brother and his clan are up to no good as t house lights go black.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE
dialogues.text: Honeycutt walks out on stage.  The audience goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so very much.  Show me some love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  My name is Honeycutt and I want to welcome you to a very special evening.  It's always great coming back to the World Famous Apollo Theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As everybody knows if you can make it here on this stage in front of the most discriminating audience in the world you can make it anywhere. Ladies and gentlemen, let's show some real Uptown love for Mantan The Marvelous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtain goes up and Mantan the Marvelous stands there arms raised.  He starts to do his thing.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAU-MAU BOX
dialogues.text: Led by Big Black, they start shouting insults at Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Mantan is a pro, he doesn't stop.  In fact, this makes hi dance harder and harder.

dialogues.speaker: ON SLOAN
dialogues.text: She leaves her seat and goes to stop her brother.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Mantan is moving and grooving.  The unrest in the audienc has picked up.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: They start to "boo."  The tide has turned.  Encouraged, t Mau-Mau's pick it up another notch.

dialogues.speaker: ON MANTAN
dialogues.text: He's human after all, and he does hear the boos.  Don't l those athletes in the papers fool you.  You hear the boos and nobody, nobody except Dennis Rodman likes to be booed Mantan is getting rattled.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAU-MAU'S BOX
dialogues.text: Sloan rushes into the box and they are quiet.  They don't have to say or shout a thing.  The rough Apollo crowd is doing it all themselves.

dialogues.speaker: SLOAN AND BIG BLACK
dialogues.text: The sister and big brother look at each other.  There is love between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't change a thing.  I will still love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Black can't believe what he has just heard.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Now projectiles are raining down upon Mantan.  This has turned into a RUCKUS, a BROUHAHA, a DONNYBROOK.  Honeycut races onto the stage to pull off the still tap dancing Mantan as the Harlem natives BUMRUSH the stage.  THE WORM HAS TURNED.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAU-MAU'S BOX
dialogues.text: Mantan, led by Honeycutt, runs for his life.

dialogues.speaker: ON MOB
dialogues.text: They chase him.

dialogues.speaker: ON BACKSTAGE DOOR
dialogues.text: Mantan is hauling ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door crashes open, Mantan rockets out into an open ca door.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAR DOOR
dialogues.text: The door slams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car spins away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is behind the wheel.  This is the most shaken we've seen Mantan to date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull ya self together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?  A man or a mouse? Are you a punk?  Punking out on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You getting scared because some people don't like what you are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, DeLa, they tried to lynch my black ass up in dat piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made it from the guttermost to the uppermost.  Don't you know you should never let them see you sweat.  Y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now is definitely not the time to bitch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is on the BET show with host TAVIS SMILEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guest tonight is the extraordinary, talented performer, Mantan.  Thanks for coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tavis, thank you for having me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we begin, I want to thank you for coming on my show for your first television interview.  You could have chosen Mike Wallace, Barbara Walters, Jane Pauley, whatnot but you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm more comfortable around my people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's jump right into it.  Your show has sparked a world of controversy, provoked a tone of dialogue.  How do you see all of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Tavis, check it out.  This is the two-one, the 21st century and it's all about the money.  Like my man Mase says, "it's all about the Benjamins."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money and nothing else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money makes the world go round.  It ain't no joke being poor.  I know whatI'mtalkin''bout. Y'knowwhatI'msayin'?  I've lived on the street.  I've been homeless. I've learned how to play the game, work the game, be in the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it inevitable that the game plays you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No if you go with the flow, Tavis. That's what a lot of Negroes don't understand.  Protesting isn't gonna do a damn thing.  If people don't like our satire in our number one hit show then don't watch it.  Or better yet write your own show.  Do it better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you feel that is a simplistic retort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what a retort is, but it's simple.  Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show is UNIVERSAL.  It's not just for Negroes in Compton or 125th in Harlem.  This is America.  Our ancestors helped build this country, we got a right, just like everybody else.  I'm not gonna box myself in. This show makes people think, and they're laughing at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit, that's a very hard thing to do.  Quickly let's go to the phones before we pay the bills and hear from our proud sponsors, DA BOMB.  125% PURE PLEASURE MALT LIQUOR.  IT MAKES YOU WANNA GET YA FREAK ON AND TIMMI HILLNIGGER. 125% AUTHENTIC GIT-TOE GEAR WHEN YOU WANT TO BE GIT-TOED FABULOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our first caller is Big Black from Brooklyn.  Go 'head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Microphone check, one, two.  One, two.  Yo Tavis, I be lovin' yo show but Mantan you is foul.  Why you perpetrating?  You a sellout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a traitor to the race.  A tool for the Caucasoids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Because I'm successful? Because I don't use "Causcasoids" as an excuse for not fulfilling my dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't hearing all dat noise.  You getting played and you don't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Big Black from Brooklyn, what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a revolutionary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a full time job, especially when sellouts like you are running around, acting insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another thing, you better stay away from my sister or you better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, there is no need to go there.  We can all agree to disagree without making threats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan turns off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you and Hambone been hangin' out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one that put us together. We're friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That crazy brother of yours doesn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just playing big brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is he?  You getting jiggy with Mantan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty and I feel you've been getting too close to him, getting his mind all messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't lie to him.  If he asks me something, I tell him what I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to be so damn forthright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeLa, you should try it sometime. Come into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That which has been hidden in darkness is now in the light.  This bucket of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk all that mumbo jumbo if you want to but your hands are much bloody.  I know where I made my big mistake.  I have a general rule, never get involved romantically with somebody crazier than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Sloan are taking off their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it will be so much fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, fall half undressed upon the motel bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake, but I don't regret it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first and only time.  A big mistake.  I'm gonna have to ask you not to see Mantan anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work related or otherwise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otherwise.  I trust you know the difference.  You're an intelligent woman, finished at NYU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeLa, kiss my big black ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's how you got me in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan pulls a 3/4 inch cassette out of her bag and hands to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to please view this.  It may save your Life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan and Delacroix are in the middle of a heated discus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't even be mad at me over Sloan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you did is dead wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is it?  Buddy boy, in this business if people don't produce, they get fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan is the hardest working person I've ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question, if I may. How do you think she got the job in the first place?  I don't mean to burst your bubble, Mantan the Marvelous, but Sloan is an opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to spell it out for you? In fact, go ask Sloan yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan is grilling Sloan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get this gig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worked my black ass off, first as an intern, then worked my way up to this position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave something out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After my internship expired, Dela was impressed and offered me a position as his assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop playing me Sloan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ask me what you want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you gonna make me say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what, Manray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever sleep with DeLa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it one time, only once.  It had nothing to do with the job, it was stupid.  Everything I've got I've earned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ancient history.  That has nothing to do with you and I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you say.  Sloan, you wuz gonna use me up just like you used Dela? Work it to the top.  I never imagined people in this biz could flip on you like "IHOP."  I'm damn happy DeLa fired ya ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about me, are you a puppet for DeLa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to change to the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I won't be your puppet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wuz leaving anyway, for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As usual, the clan is smoking and drinking DA BOMB, a thi marijuana haze hangs over the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I got da bomb plan.  We gonna hook homeslice Mantan up nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a floppy disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix sits behind the desk.  He's bought even more Bl Collectibles, he's surrounded by them.

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: He dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mommy, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing okay.  Been reading about your show, it's all over everywhere. I watched it's all over everywhere. I watched it once.  I thought you said there would be no buffoonery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to attack me too.  The show is a hit.  Aren't you happy for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm happy for you. You've worked very hard for your success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I have, very hard.  Has Daddy called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how your Daddy is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If and when he calls, please don't forget to ask him if he's seen Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't forget.  When are you coming up here to see your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix hangs up the phone.  He takes out some change f his pocket and puts a quarter in the hand of his Jolly Nigger Bank.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON JNB
dialogues.text: Delacroix flips the lever and the quarter flies into the MOUTH as the EYES roll to the top of its HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix does this several times.  CLOSEUPS of the BLACK COLLECTIBLES in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is staring at the JNB when its MOUTH OPENS, a quarter flies in and its EYES roll to the top of its HEAD

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: He is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I thought or imagined that my favorite Jolly Nigger Bank, an inanimate object, a piece of cold, cast iron, was moving by itself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix slowly, carefully approaches the bank and picks off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I knew I was getting paranoid. Did I really see what I saw or was I buggin'?

dialogues.speaker: ON JNB
dialogues.text: It's stopped moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt is warming up the crazed "Black Face"-wearing audience.  He points to a YOUNG WHITE MALE, BOBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is you a nigga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, I'm a nigga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE CHEERS WILDLY.  Honeycutt points to an old WHITE LADY, LOUISE, a senior citizen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, is you a nigga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesiree Bob, you darn tootin' I'm a nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE loses it as Honeycutt hugs Louise as if she' grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan looks up at his makeup laid out before him on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON MANTAN
dialogues.text: He stares at himself in the dressing room mirror.  Mantan can't stand to BLACK UP anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt stands next to a young black couple TRE and STA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a nigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a nigga?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt, I'm a really real niggress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacy gets a standing ovation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  You.  Him.  Her.  We're all God's niggas.  Even the lost souls who don't know it are niggas cuz niggas is a beautiful thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mantan walks down the hallway WE NOTICE he is not dres in his costume and he has no BLACK FACE on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Worker is painting over Sleep 'N Eat's name on the door and replacing it with HONEYCUTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't waste any time, do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings next to Delacroix and he answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix.  What?!  I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is met by BUNNING, the STAGE MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better talk to him.  He won't listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix walks over to Mantan who stands in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantan, we got a show to tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Manray, goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kook and the Gang, it's Manray. Let's do the taping.  You go back to your dressing room, get dressed and blacken up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playin' myself no mo'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't do it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray, I'm very sorry about ya boy Cheeba and Sloan.  Believe me, it gave me no joy pulling ya coattail about her, just lookin' out for a brother.  I feel you, all this stuff happenin' at once but you can't let if affect your work.  You gotta be professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always gonna be that.  But I ain't doing no more buck dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No costume.  No blackface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray leads the way to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should notify Dunwitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I should put my foot dead up in yo' ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be held responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honeycutt stands in front of the drawn curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We apologize for the holdup but without further delay, ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, let's give it up for Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, don't be niggardly, give it up.  Show Mantan some love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CURTAIN RISES and MANRAY stands before them in his regular street clothes and NO BLACK FACE.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The THUNDEROUS ROAR is CUT OFF LIKE the LIGHTS, LIKE CON EDISON PULLS THE PLUG WHEN YOU DON'T PAY THE BILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty is HYSTERICAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the tape.  Stop the tape. Delacroix.  Get me Delacroix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray speaks to the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousins, I want all of you to go to your windows.  Go to your windows and yell, scream with all the life you can muster up inside your assaulted, bruised amd battered bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick and tired of being a nigger and I'm not gonna take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ON VARIOUS AUDIENCE MEMBERS
dialogues.text: Black and white.  Male and female.  Young and old.  All i black face.

dialogues.speaker: ON MANRAY
dialogues.text: He collapses onto the stage and the AUDIENCE sits on thei hands.  Manray gets up and begins to dance.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Dunwitty runs to Bunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the curtain.  Drop the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunning drops the curtain.  Security rushes onto the stag and grabs Manray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort him out the building now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't finished doing my dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are finished.  Done. Nigga's like you are a dime a dozen. I'm gonna slide Honeycutt right into ya spot.  We won't miss a step. Get him outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guards move Manray as Dunitty glares at Delacroix.  Honeycutt is all smiles, he's being bumped to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeLa, I'll deal with you next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guards toss Manray out the stage door.  Manr looks down the alley and it's empty except for a parked S He picks himself up and does a joyous dance.  This is Manray's dance of Freedom.

dialogues.speaker: ON STREET
dialogues.text: The Big Black Chevy Suburban creeps down the alley to a dancing Manray and comes to rest right in front of him. Manray tries to shield his eyes from the hi-beam headligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and the Mau-Mau's file out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You truly are a dancing fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Black, you looking for trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start none, won't be none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's are dying laughing.  Manray tries to walk through them.  They block him.  Manray attempts to climb over the suburban.  He's quickly nabbed, give a good ole Brooklyn Beatdown, then thrown into the rear of the vehic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau Mobile rolls up to an abandoned factory.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHEVY SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's quickly carry Manray out from the back of t vehicle into the factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray sits, feet and hands tied, in the middle of a cavernous space.  A digital video camera stands on a trip in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You is one dead nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brothers, he asks what did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't know there is nuthin' we can do for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, you will be executed.

dialogues.speaker: ON MANRAY
dialogues.text: His face says he can't believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For singing and dancing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be done in front of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole world will be watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Via the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's had come up with a brilliant, sadistic plan to broadcast Mantan's execution LIVE over the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have pirated broadcasting facilities.  No way we can be found out.  We're in cyberspace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody will find you till it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various newsrooms, computer screens, people running, shouting, yelling over phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's sent anonymous e-mail proclamations to the websites of CNN, ABC, MSNBC and CBS.  It was an invite to witness the Dance of Death, 9 PM, prime time, tomorrow night on a site to be designated at a later date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Cheeba are being interrogated in two adjoin spaces.  WE ARE seeing them through the two-way mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no joke getting grilled by the FBI for five houts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you're involved in this abduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know more than me.  Why would I do something like that to my best friend?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mob scene as the media frenzy heightens.  Delacroi and Cheeba try to fight their way through the print and broadcast journalists trying to question them as they lea FBI headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow, someway, somebody had tipped the sharks off.  It was a feeding frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Cheeba start pushing people out of the way they get in to their waiting car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a flurry of activity - people man phones, comput all HI-TECH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The X-Force was brought onto the case.  When something involves the internet, these are the people IBM, XEROX, the CIA, FBI, even the US Government go to.

dialogues.speaker: ON CLOCK
dialogues.text: It reads "T-minus 19 HOURS 22 MINUTES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a race against time.  The Dance of Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunwitty is taping a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my name is Thomas Dunwitty. I'm the Senior V.P. of the entertainment division here at CNS. I come to you with a heavy heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's watching Dunwitty on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This abduction is a cowardly, vile, sinful and dastardly act and I promise these creeps will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.  This is an attack on your American way of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's watching the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We here at CNS are offering a $100,000 cash award to any information that leads to the safe return home of our dear friend, Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us and in addition you will get a guest-starring speaking role on the next Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show, plus an added bonus: a lifetime of Da Bomb 125% Malt Liquor.  Let's you get ya "freak on", as well as a full wardrobe of Timmi Hillnigger Active Git Toe Wear.  Mantan, may God bless you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix and Sloan hurry to stay with BARNETT, he's the commander of the X-Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, time's wasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow Barnett into the war room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sent the notice out on an anonymous remailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's used to mask the origin of an email, also the computer from which it's sent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There oughta be a law...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, anyway, it's legal.  We will find the source where it's being broadcasted and hosted. We'll get the people that bushwhacked Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Manray is dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't answer that.

dialogues.speaker: ON CLOCK
dialogues.text: It reads "6 HOURS 16 MINUTES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police squads, SWAT Teams are busting into the wrong home apartments, projects, hi-tech computer labs looking for t Mau-Mau's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT teams all up and down the East Coast busted in on known dissidents looking for Manray.  All the tips called in, info gathered through surveillance proved for naught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The both of you should go home.  We will keep you abreast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is looking like a needle in a haystack.  It's hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix holds Sloan as he leads her out.  She is having difficulty breathing with her asthma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The X-Force always gets their man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in front of his GIANT SCREEN, on the desk in fron of him is the 3/4 inch cassette Sloan gave him.  He picks up and turns it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was ten o'clock and the Dance of Death was about to commence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since a lot of people still didn't have computers, the networks sought a court order to carry it live, taking the feed off the internet. It was granted.  A life snuff broadcast right into your living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to give it to the Mau-Mau', they definitely had a sense of irony.  They chose www.nigger.com as the website to pirate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's ironically wear WHITE MASKS, they stand beh the tied-up Mantan.  A device alters their voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are LIVE on the cyberspace. Whereas Mantan is a TOM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereas Mantan is a disgrace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereas Mantan is a head-scratching, foot-shuffling Negro...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereas, whereas, where's the ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whereas Mantan the dancing fool, you are condemned to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dance of Death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1/16th Black unties Manray.

dialogues.speaker: ON COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see a CARTOON, Yosemite Sam is shooting at the feet of Bugs Bunny with his six-shooter in each hand.  Bugs Bunny doing a fast dance, dodging bullets.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONITOR
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's shoot at the feet of Manray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dance nigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray taps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got anything to say for yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're gonna kill me, kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is having an asthma attack, it was brought on by the proceedings.  Sloan uses her inhaler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each Mau-Mau has a 9mm and is firing it at the feet of Manray.  They scream "Faster!" and "Dance!" Manray is hoofing.  He's never tapped this fast, at this breakneck pace, ever.  But it's evident his dance is one of defianc He's not dancing to stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He screams at the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't dance.  Don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's have noticed Manray's strong will, his prid and they don't like it.  They shoot even more at his feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't Blak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blak you ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a Oreo.  Not Blak.  Not BLAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's start to chant, "Blak, blak, blak."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears this and quickly picks up the phone to call the authorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing you can do to me. I'm wearing the taps of Bill "Bojangles" Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray is shot in one foot.  Then the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's seeya dance now, Mr. Bojangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manray somehow manages to right himself and starts to dan again.  The Mau-Mau's can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: ON MANRAY
dialogues.text: He dances like his life depends on it.  Despite the fact feet are a bloody mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain' BLAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots Manray in the chest, the Mau-Mau's follow him a he does a spastic last jig as the 9mm bullets riddle his twitching body.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: It goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopters fly through the night sky.  Cop cars and truc SWAT team vehicles are on the move.  SIRENS BLARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix's head is on his desk.  He has been crying.  On cue the Black Collectibles start to move.  The Jolly Nigg Bank, Aunt Jemima's, Mammies, etc., they are animated for REAL.

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: His head pops up as he sees the objects.  He too is in BLACKFACE.  In a rage, he starts to throw them against th wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.  Get away from me. You spearchucker.  You black sambo. You nigger pickaninny.  Fat Mammie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix has finally lost it.  He looks at the shambles he's made of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mau-Mau's come out of the factory high as a kite.  Ea has a big fat joint or a 64 oz. of DA BOMB.  They're also doing a free-style rap about their execution.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHEVY SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: They get in when the squak of police walkie-talkie's clic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What follows is a horrifying display of firepower.  All t Mau-Mau's bodies are doing the Bonnie and Clyde Sonny Corleone Dance of Death as bullets tear into them and the Suburban.  Not one of them is able to get a shot off.  Th shooting stops.  The twitching stops.  All's quiet.  1/16 Black comes out with his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!  Don't shoot!  I've been held hostage.  They made me part of them against my own free will.  Don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops quickly pounce on 1/16th Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm WHITE.  I'm WHITE!  Look at me, I'm white!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix is on the floor when the doorknob turns.  It's Sloan and she has a gun in one hand and her inhaler in th other.  She's wheezing like mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up and put that tape in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points the gun at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix takes the cassette tape off his desk and puts i in the 3/4 inch desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me have to use this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think this was in your studies at NYU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix hits the PLAY button.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: IMAGES.  HISTORY.  VISUALS.  Sloan has put together a tap of the worst, most racist, stereotypical images from cine and TV over the last 100 years.  With these images there' also a laugh-track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this.  This is what you contributed to.  Because of you, Manray is dead.  Mu brother's dead. It's all because of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix can't watch the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't know anyone would get hurt.  I'm sorry, please give me that gun before you hurt yourself.  Give me the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for it.  BOOM!  Sloan screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you but you wouldn't listen. You never listened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reluctantly hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, get out of here.  Go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloan runs out.  Delacroix slumps to the floor, WIPES HER FINGERPRINTS off the revolver.

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: He looks at the monitor, the tape still playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I bled to death, as my very precious life oozed out of me all I could think of was that I never made my father proud.  My mother didn't count.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see STEP 'N FETCHIT, MANTAN MORELAND and WILLIE BEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I did, no matter how great or small, was always extraordinary to her.  With Daddy it was a different ball game.  He never saw me.  Pierre Delacroix.

dialogues.speaker: ON DELACROIX
dialogues.text: A pool of blood has formed around his dying body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it was time to buy the farm, for me to meet my maker.  Goodbye cousins, and please tune in next week for the Best of Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see MANTAN in BLACKFACE doing his BUCKDANCE

dialogues.speaker: DELACROIX
dialogues.text: He looks at Mantan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the love of Joseph and Mary, what have I done?  My God, what have I done?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delacroix slumps over dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been had.  You've been took. You've been led astray.  Run amok. You've been bamboozled.
